Virtual Raster Builder

The Virtual Raster Builder allows to create GDAL Virtual Raster
(VRT) by simple drag and drop of source bands.

To build a new virtual raster (VRT) follow these steps:

  1. Add potential source files to the list of source files:

    Button Action
    add source raster
    remove source raster
    load raster known to QGIS
    expand source file tree node(s)
    collapse source file tree node(s)

  2. Specify the VRT structure by drag and drop of source bands

    Button Action
    add virtual band
    remove virtual band
    import virtual bands from existing VRT file
    expand VRT tree node(s)
    collapse VRT tree node(s)

    Virtual band names can be changed by mouse double-click.

  3. Specify other VRT settings:

    • set spatial resolution
    • set the resampling method
    • set spatial extent
    • set output format

  4. Save the new file as VRT. In case you selected another output format, like GeoTiff, the VRt is created first and then translated to it's final format using gdal.Translate
